alert.note: Alert for Blackfoot Mountains; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 3:03PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Line of weak thunderstorms from Pocatello to Sublett sweeping east through the southern highlands through 400 PM MDT... At 301 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pocatello to 14 miles south of Fort Hall Bannock Creek Lodge to 7 miles south of Fort Hall Bannock Peak to 7 miles northwest of Juniper. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pocatello, McCammon, Chesterfield Reservoir, Inkom, Arimo, Portneuf Gap, Fort Hall Mount Putnam, Chesterfield, Pauline, Cutthroat Trout Campground, Mink Creek Pass, Sweetzer Summit, Hawkins Reservoir, Arbon, Sublett Reservoir, and Roy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Blackfoot Mountains; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region
